abstract: The Pico Projector, from Microvision, takes a cell phone image and projects it project an image onto a nearby surface the equivalent size of a 60-inch television screen.

lead_paragraph: Following up on my last post: what if you didn’t have to strap on a pair of geeky goggles to watch video on your iPod, cell phone or video game console, but could project the device’s image on a nearby wall or surface? That’s the premise of Microvision, a company from Redmond, Wash., and its pocket-sized, laser-powered Pico Projector.
